content.text:
# Draft:2028 United States presidential election in New York

The 2028 United States presidential election in New York is scheduled to take place on Tuesday, November 7, 2028, as part of the 2028 United States presidential election in which all 50 states plus the District of Columbia will participate. New York voters will choose electors to represent them in the Electoral College via a popular vote. The state of New York has 28 electoral votes in the Electoral College, following reapportionment due to the 2020 United States census in which the state lost a seat.
